parameters.name: nodegroupName
parameters.description: The name of the node group to describe.

nested_items.name: nodegroup
nested_items.description: The full description of your node group.

nested_items.name: nodegroupName
nested_items.description: The name associated with an Amazon EKS managed node group.

nested_items.name: nodegroupArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the managed node group.

nested_items.name: clusterName
nested_items.description: The name of your cluster.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: The Kubernetes version of the managed node group.

nested_items.name: releaseVersion
nested_items.description: If the node group was deployed using a launch template with a custom AMI, then this is the AMI ID that was specified in the launch template. For node groups that weren't deployed using a launch template, this is the version of the Amazon EKS optimized AMI that the node group was deployed with.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The Unix epoch timestamp at object creation.

nested_items.name: modifiedAt
nested_items.description: The Unix epoch timestamp for the last modification to the object.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The current status of the managed node group.

nested_items.name: capacityType
nested_items.description: The capacity type of your managed node group.

nested_items.name: scalingConfig
nested_items.description: The scaling configuration details for the Auto Scaling group that is associated with your node group.

nested_items.name: minSize
nested_items.description: The minimum number of nodes that the managed node group can scale in to.

nested_items.name: maxSize
nested_items.description: The maximum number of nodes that the managed node group can scale out to. For information about the maximum number that you can specify, see Amazon EKS service quotas in the Amazon EKS User Guide.

nested_items.name: desiredSize
nested_items.description: The current number of nodes that the managed node group should maintain.

nested_items.name: instanceTypes
nested_items.description: If the node group wasn't deployed with a launch template, then this is the instance type that is associated with the node group. If the node group was deployed with a launch template, then this is null.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: subnets
nested_items.description: The subnets that were specified for the Auto Scaling group that is associated with your node group.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: remoteAccess
nested_items.description: If the node group wasn't deployed with a launch template, then this is the remote access configuration that is associated with the node group. If the node group was deployed with a launch template, then this is null.

nested_items.name: ec2SshKey
nested_items.description: The Amazon EC2 SSH key name that provides access for SSH communication with the nodes in the managed node group. For more information, see Amazon EC2 key pairs and Linux instances in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide for Linux Instances. For Windows, an Amazon EC2 SSH key is used to obtain the RDP password. For more information, see Amazon EC2 key pairs and Windows instances in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide for Windows Instances.

nested_items.name: sourceSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: The security group IDs that are allowed SSH access (port 22) to the nodes. For Windows, the port is 3389. If you specify an Amazon EC2 SSH key but don't specify a source security group when you create a managed node group, then the port on the nodes is opened to the internet ( 0.0.0.0/0). For more information, see Security Groups for Your VPC in the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud User Guide.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: amiType
nested_items.description: If the node group was deployed using a launch template with a custom AMI, then this is CUSTOM. For node groups that weren't deployed using a launch template, this is the AMI type that was specified in the node group configuration.

nested_items.name: nodeRole
nested_items.description: The IAM role associated with your node group. The Amazon EKS node kubelet daemon makes calls to Amazon Web Services APIs on your behalf. Nodes receive permissions for these API calls through an IAM instance profile and associated policies.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: taints
nested_items.description: The Kubernetes taints to be applied to the nodes in the node group when they are created. Effect is one of No_Schedule, Prefer_No_Schedule, or No_Execute. Kubernetes taints can be used together with tolerations to control how workloads are scheduled to your nodes. For more information, see Node taints on managed node groups.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: The key of the taint.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the taint.

nested_items.name: effect
nested_items.description: The effect of the taint.

nested_items.name: resources
nested_items.description: The resources associated with the node group, such as Auto Scaling groups and security groups for remote access.

nested_items.name: autoScalingGroups
nested_items.description: The Auto Scaling groups associated with the node group.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the Auto Scaling group associated with an Amazon EKS managed node group.

nested_items.name: remoteAccessSecurityGroup
nested_items.description: The remote access security group associated with the node group. This security group controls SSH access to the nodes.

nested_items.name: diskSize
nested_items.description: If the node group wasn't deployed with a launch template, then this is the disk size in the node group configuration. If the node group was deployed with a launch template, then this is null.

nested_items.name: issues
nested_items.description: Any issues that are associated with the node group.

nested_items.name: code
nested_items.description: A brief description of the error.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: The error message associated with the issue.

nested_items.name: resourceIds
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services resources that are afflicted by this issue.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: updateConfig
nested_items.description: The node group update configuration.

nested_items.name: maxUnavailable
nested_items.description: The maximum number of nodes unavailable at once during a version update. Nodes are updated in parallel. This value or maxUnavailablePercentage is required to have a value.The maximum number is 100.

nested_items.name: maxUnavailablePercentage
nested_items.description: The maximum percentage of nodes unavailable during a version update. This percentage of nodes are updated in parallel, up to 100 nodes at once. This value or maxUnavailable is required to have a value.

nested_items.name: updateStrategy
nested_items.description: The configuration for the behavior to follow during a node group version update of this managed node group. You choose between two possible strategies for replacing nodes during an UpdateNodegroupVersion action.

nested_items.name: nodeRepairConfig
nested_items.description: The node auto repair configuration for the node group.

nested_items.name: enabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether to enable node auto repair for the node group. Node auto repair is disabled by default.

nested_items.name: launchTemplate
nested_items.description: If a launch template was used to create the node group, then this is the launch template that was used.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the launch template.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: The version number of the launch template to use. If no version is specified, then the template's default version is used. You can use a different version for node group updates.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The ID of the launch template.
(string) ---
(string) ---
